qas.question: How many people protested on the San Francisco torch route?
How many people protested at the Pyongyang torch route?
What were some groups doing along the torch route that was not supportive of the Olympics?
Who put out the torch along the route for protection?

context: In many cities along the North American and European route, the torch relay was protested by advocates of Tibetan independence, animal rights, and legal online gambling, and people <a2_0>protesting<a2_0/> against China's human rights record, resulting in confrontations at a few of the relay locations. These protests, which ranged from <a0_0>hundreds<a0_0/> of people in San Francisco, to <a1_0>effectively none<a1_0/> in Pyongyang, forced the path of the torch relay to be changed or shortened on a number of occasions. The torch was extinguished by <a3_0>Chinese security officials<a3_0/> several times during the Paris leg for security reasons, and once in protest in Paris.
